Same boat.  Looking for a $75 - $85 exit...if it ever happens.  So many better investments out there right now. At least there is that dividend....

Also BP Wells doesn't really like dealing with them (at least offshore). I've seen them get booted off of a bunch of rigs in lieu of other players who were willing to put together less bundled contracts (though some bundling is now the norm).Also a crappy corporate culture, similar stupidity to that exhibited by GE. They're French, after all. ðŸ˜Ž Then they bought Cameron, which is almost entirely capex based (except the spares business which can bring in ~5-7% residuals on their installed base per annum). They dominate the offshore drilling BOP space (which got obliterated in 2015-2016) but the subsea tree space is facing a lot of competition from FMC and Aker.
